About Me

After obtained my Ph.D. degree in Biomedicine from Tsinghua University, I became a Postdoctoral Fellow at Ichan School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, Akar Lab. I kept on learning new skills and built my own workstation for large scale gene sequencing analysis. With the help of my new skills I published many research papers on prestige journals and was invited as the editor and reviewer for the journals. As an alien of extraordinary ability, I was granted permanent residency via EB-1A. I knew I couldn't teach myself everything I wanted to learn, so I went back to Columbia University for the Master degreee in Computer Science. In 2018, I worked as a Research Scientist at Graphen, Inc for 8 months then was promoted as the Principal Research Scientist of Big Data. Most of time I work as a DevOps engineer to design the RESTful layer, develop customer client, deploy and implement System automation. Sometimes I also work as a data scientist for feature selection, model building and evaluation. I have gained domain knowledge of finance, healthcare, cybersecurity in my current position.
